Proxy.name: CGALAlphaWrappingProxy

Documentation.short_help: Generate a valid triangulated surface mesh that strictly contains the input
Documentation.long_help: Generate a valid triangulated surface mesh that strictly contains the input (watertight, intersection-free and 2-manifold).

Proxy.Documentation: Two user-defined parameters, alpha and offset, offer control over the maximum size of cavities where the shrink-wrapping process can enter, and the tightness of the final surface mesh to the input, respectively. Once combined, these parameters provide a means to trade fidelity to the input for complexity of the output.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Alpha
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Parameter to control the size(diameter) of the cavaties to appear in the Output. The algorithm can only shrink-wrap through straits or holes with diameters larger than alpha. This parameter thus also behaves like a sizing criterion on the triangle facets of the output.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Offset
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Parameter to control the distance of output mesh vertuces from the input. Recommend to set the offset parameter to a small fraction of alpha, so that alpha becomes the main parameter that controls the final level of detail.
